TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TaskLoggingHelperExtension extends Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper

Docs.summary: Enables logging of various messages. Also, enables loading and formatting of resources.

MemberSignature.Value: public TaskLoggingHelperExtension (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask taskInstance, System.Resources.ResourceManager primaryResources, System.Resources.ResourceManager sharedResources, string helpKeywordPrefix);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask taskInstance, class System.Resources.ResourceManager primaryResources, class System.Resources.ResourceManager sharedResources, string helpKeywordPrefix) cil managed

Docs.param: A task containing an instance of the class.
The prefix for composing Help keywords.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the task instance, primary resources, shared resources, and a Help keyword prefix.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string FormatResourceString (string resourceName, object[] args);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string FormatResourceString(string resourceName, object[] args) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the string resource to load.
Optional arguments for formatting the loaded string, or .
Docs.summary: Loads the specified resource string and optionally formats it using the given arguments. The current thread's culture is used for formatting.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method requires the owner task to have registered its resources either via the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or one of the following properties: <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.TaskResources%2A> or <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.AppDomainIsolatedTask.TaskResources%2A>.
This method is thread-safe.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the shared UI and string resources.
Docs.value: The shared UI and string resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used to load culture-specific resources. Derived classes should register their resources either during construction, or via this property, if they have localized strings.
